{{Infobox football biography |name = Nya Kirby |image = |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Nya Jerome Kirby{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/1034294|title=Updated squad lists for 2018/19 Premier League |publisher=Premier League |date=1 February 2019 |accessdate=1 February 2019}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|2000|1|31|df=y}}{{soccerway|nya-kirby/478365/|accessdate=11 January 2019}} |birth_place = [[Islington]], England |height = 1.73m{{cite web |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/nya-kirby-255722/ |title=Nya Kirby|website=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=2 February 2019}} |position = [[Midfielder]] |currentclub = [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]]
(on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]) |clubnumber = 23 |youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2017 |youthclubs1 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] |youthyears2 = 2017–2018 |youthclubs2 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] |years1 = 2018– |clubs1 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] |caps1 = 0 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2019– |clubs2 = → [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] (loan) |caps2 = 3 |goals2 = 0 |nationalyears1 = |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] |nationalcaps1 = |nationalgoals1 = |nationalyears2 = |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] |nationalcaps2 = |nationalgoals2 = |club-update = 10:36, 18 February 2019 (UTC) |ntupdate = 14:46, 11 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Nya Jerome Kirby''' (born 31 January 2000) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]], on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], as a [[midfielder]]. ==Career== Kirby played youth football for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], before moving on loan to [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] in January 2019.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46840867|title=Nya Kirby: Crystal Palace midfielder joins Blackpool on loan|date=11 January 2019|accessdate=11 January 2019|publisher=BBC Sport}} He made his debut for Blackpool on 29 January 2019, coming off the bench in a 2–2 draw with [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]] and winning the 85th minute [[penalty kick|penalty]] which [[Harry Pritchard (footballer)|Harry Pritchard]] scored to earn a point.{{cite web|url=https://www.blackpoolgazette.co.uk/sport/football/blackpool-fc/terry-mcphillips-explains-why-nya-kirby-wasn-t-allowed-to-take-blackpool-s-late-penalty-in-wycombe-draw-1-9565187|title=Terry McPhillips explains why Nya Kirby wasn't allowed to take Blackpool's late penalty in Wycombe draw|date=30 January 2019|accessdate=30 January 2019|author=Matt Scrafton|publisher=Blackpool Gazette}} He has represented England at under-17 and under-19 international youth levels. He won the [[2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46800068|title=England's U17 World Cup winners - where are they now?|date=17 January 2019|accessdate=17 January 2019|author=Shamoon Hafez|publisher=BBC Sport}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Blackpool F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kirby, Nya}} [[Category:2000 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:English footballers]] [[Category:People from the London Borough of Islington]] [[Category:Tottenham Hotspur F.C. players]] [[Category:Crystal Palace F.C. players]] [[Category:Blackpool F.C. players]] [[Category:English Football League players]] [[Category:Association football midfielders]] [[Category:England youth international footballers]] {{England-footy-bio-stub}}
